headline: Anti-corruption: NGO Sensitises Kaduna Schools, Markets, Communities
summarized_story:
A non-governmental organisation (NGO), Legal Awareness for Nigerian Women (LANW) with support from MacAuthur Foundation under her Strengthening Accountability and Transparency in Nigeria Education Sector (STATNES) project, has taken campaign against all forms of corruption in the system to various schools, markets and communities in Chikun, Soba and Kaura local government areas of Kaduna State.
The executive director of LANW, Barrister Rebecca Sako-John, alongside her team, who embarked on the outreach, said the campaign against corruption in the society is needed now more than ever before considering the high rate of corruption in various segments of the society.
“Some of the common causes of corruption in Nigeria are greed, poverty, economic Insecurity, lack of moral values, un-patriotism and storage wish to acquire material wealth.
Corruption in Nigeria can be political, economical, Bureaucratic, Judicial, moral and electoral,” she said.
She called on government to tighten its grip on fiscal policy, monitor monetary policy, cut wasteful spending, restore public institutions to their past glories, repairs and build new infrastructures, strengthen law enforcement and anti-corruption agencies and ensure accountability in it’s tax management.
